thread.title: The top 10 AFL forwards, according to Browny
thread.title_full: The top 10 AFL forwards, according to Browny

title: The top 10 AFL forwards, according to Browny
text:
'Gabba ready for Round 2" 1:25 Jonathan Brown nominates his top 10 AFL forwards heading into 2017 season with some notable exclusions March 20, 2017 9:33pm Source: FOX SPORTS HE’S one of the game’s superstars and features for one of the league’s best teams — but Sydney Swan Lance Franklin has been usurped as the game’s best forward. 
That’s according to Brisbane Lions great Jonathan Brown who has ranked his top ten forwards heading into 2017. 
Brown placed Gold Coast Suns gun Tom Lynch at the top of his list, ahead of the two men who finished ahead of him in the Coleman medal race in 2017 — Franklin and West Coast Eagle Josh Kennedy. 
The champion goalkicker was full of praise for Lynch who he declared was similar to former AFL superstar Wayne Carey. 
“Tom Lynch’s all-round numbers are similar to Carey. They are Carey-like,” Brown told Fox Footy’s On the Couch . 
LISTEN TO THE LATEST FOX FOOTY PODCAST BELOW, OR TAP HERE TO SUBSCRIBE IN ITUNES 
“He sets up goals, is a good goalkicker and is the best contested mark in the competition. What more can I say?” 
Brown then ranked Eddie Betts ahead of Cyril Rioli in the race to be the game’s best small forward, preferring the Crow’s numbers from 2017. 
Betts’ captain Taylor Walker slotted in sixth with GWS Giant and 2016 All-Australian Toby Greene then ahead of returning Hawk Jarryd Roughead. Cat Tom Hawkins and Tiger Jack Riewoldt rounded out the top ten. 
However the list doesn’t include two of the game’s most exciting and promising young tall forwards in the game, with Collingwood’s Darcy Moore and Melbourne’s Jesse Hogan both not making the cut. 
JONATHAN BROWN’S TOP 10 FORWARDS AS OF ROUND 1, 2017 
1. Tom Lynch (Gold Coast Suns) 
2. Lance Franklin (Sydney Swans) 
3. Josh Kennedy (West Coast Eagles) 
4. Eddie Betts (Adelaide)
